entry.title: New DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule released (0.8)
entry.summary:
A new DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule has been released!

We have a new talk: “From Development to Production, Getting Actionable Insights to Optimize Django Code Performance” by Jérôme Vieilledent .

entry.title: New DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule released (0.7)
entry.summary:
A new DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule has been released!

No changes are visible in this version, but be assured we're working on cool new versions behind the scenes.

entry.title: New DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule released (0.6)
entry.summary:
A new DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule has been released!

Nothing has changed, we just wanted to change the version name. It was going out of style.

entry.title: New DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule released (0.3)
entry.summary:
A new DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule has been released!

We had to move some talks, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “Managing multiple Django services in a single repo” by Benjy Weinberger (June 3, 2021, 3:45 p.m. → June 3, 2021, 3:30 p.m.)
  • “Cleanroom Software Engineering with Django” by Francisco J. López-Lira Hinojo (June 4, 2021, 12:20 p.m. → June 4, 2021, noon)
  • “Migrations and understanding Django's relationship with its database” by David Wobrock (June 4, 2021, 10:05 a.m. → June 4, 2021, 9:45 a.m.)
  • “Deploying a Django Virtual Event Platform Using Containers and Terraform” by Calvin Hendryx-Parker (June 3, 2021, 5:20 p.m. → June 3, 2021, 5 p.m.)
  • “Getting started with React, GraphQL, and Django” by Aaron Bassett (June 2, 2021, 10 a.m. → June 2, 2021, 9:45 a.m.)
  • “What about DjangoCon Europe 2022?” by David Vaz, Miguel Magalhães (June 4, 2021, 4:50 p.m. → June 4, 2021, 4:45 p.m.)
  • “Django Sketchnoting Challenge” by Sara Peeters (June 2, 2021, 3:45 p.m. → June 2, 2021, 3:30 p.m.)
  • “Profiling Django & Python apps” by Jérôme Vieilledent, Sümer Cip (June 3, 2021, 11:30 a.m. → June 3, 2021, 9:45 a.m.)
  • “Teaching cPython, Turtle Graphics, and Jinja2 in the Browser” by Christopher Lozinski (June 2, 2021, 12:15 p.m. → June 2, 2021, noon)
  • “Django Unstuck: Suggestions for common challenges in your projects” by Johannes Spielmann (June 3, 2021, 11:30 a.m. → June 3, 2021, noon)

entry.title: New DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule released (0.2)
entry.summary:
A new DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule has been released!

We had to move some talks, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “Hacking Django Channels for Fun (and Profit)” by Calvin Hendryx-Parker (June 3, 2021, 11 a.m. → June 3, 2021, 10:45 a.m.)
  • “Serving Files with Django” by Jochen Wersdörfer (June 4, 2021, 4:45 p.m. → June 4, 2021, 4:35 p.m.)
  • “Telepath - adding the missing link between Django and rich client apps” by Matt Westcott (June 2, 2021, 11:45 a.m. → June 2, 2021, 11:30 a.m.)
  • “Your very own real time chat with Django Channels” by Amanda Savluchinske (June 2, 2021, 11 a.m. → June 2, 2021, 10:45 a.m.)
  • “HTMX: Frontend Revolution” by Thomas Güttler (June 3, 2021, 3:15 p.m. → June 3, 2021, 3:05 p.m.)
  • “Unlocking the full potential of PostgreSQL indexes in Django” by Haki Benita (June 2, 2021, 10:15 a.m. → June 2, 2021, 10 a.m.)
  • “Rewriting Django from (almost) scratch in 2021” by Emma Delescolle (June 4, 2021, 10:15 a.m. → June 4, 2021, 10 a.m.)
  • “Full-stack Django Rest Framework” by Israel da Silva Teixeira, Thiago Garcia da Silva (June 2, 2021, 3:15 p.m. → June 2, 2021, 3:05 p.m.)
  • “Writing Safe Database Migrations” by Markus Holtermann (June 2, 2021, 4 p.m. → June 2, 2021, 3:50 p.m.)
  • “Dynamic static sites with Django and Sphinx” by Carlton Gibson (June 3, 2021, 9:30 a.m. → June 3, 2021, 9:15 a.m.)
  • “Anvil: Full Stack Web with Nothing but Python” by Meredydd Luff (June 3, 2021, 10:15 a.m. → June 3, 2021, 10 a.m.)
  • “KEYNOTE | We're all part of this: Jazzband 5 years later” by Jannis Leidel (he/him) (June 4, 2021, 2 p.m. → June 4, 2021, 1:50 p.m.)
  • “Load Testing a Django Application using LocustIO” by Pranjal Jain, Vibhash Chandra (June 4, 2021, 12:30 p.m. → June 4, 2021, 12:15 p.m.)
  • “Programming for pleasure” by Daniele Procida (June 2, 2021, 9:30 a.m. → June 2, 2021, 9:15 a.m.)
  • “Securing Django Applications” by Gajendra Deshpande (June 4, 2021, 5:30 p.m. → June 4, 2021, 5:20 p.m.)
  • “(A) SQL for Django” by Stefan Baerisch (June 2, 2021, 12:30 p.m. → June 2, 2021, 12:15 p.m.)
  • “Clean Architecture with Django: Rethinking basic assumptions” by Paul Wolf (June 3, 2021, 12:30 p.m. → June 3, 2021, 12:15 p.m.)
  • “All about The Django Software Foundation (DSF)” by Anna Makarudze (June 4, 2021, 4 p.m. → June 4, 2021, 3:50 p.m.)
  • “Django with PostgreSQL superpowers” by Paolo Melchiorre (June 3, 2021, 4:45 p.m. → June 3, 2021, 4:35 p.m.)
  • “Modern JavaScript for Django Developers” by Cory Zue (June 3, 2021, 11:45 a.m. → June 3, 2021, 11:30 a.m.)
  • “How to create a full-stack, reactive website in Django with absolutely no JavaScript” by Adam Hill (June 3, 2021, 5:30 p.m. → June 3, 2021, 5:20 p.m.)
  • “You might not need a frontend framework” by Afonso Cerejeira (June 3, 2021, 4 p.m. → June 3, 2021, 3:50 p.m.)
  • “KEYNOTE | Spreading our tentacles - taking a Django app global” by Frederike Jaeger (June 3, 2021, 2 p.m. → June 3, 2021, 1:50 p.m.)
  • “KEYNOTE | How to be a djangonaut in a climate emergency” by Chris Adams (June 2, 2021, 2 p.m. → June 2, 2021, 1:50 p.m.)
  • “Hunting Performance in Django Code” by Sümer Cip (June 2, 2021, 4:45 p.m. → June 2, 2021, 4:35 p.m.)
  • “Domain Driven Design with Django and GraphQL” by Patrick Arminio (June 2, 2021, 5:30 p.m. → June 2, 2021, 5:20 p.m.)
  • “The request/response cycle - a Djangonautic journey” by Timothy McCurrach (June 4, 2021, 3:15 p.m. → June 4, 2021, 3:05 p.m.)
  • “Build, deploy and scale: Django, GraphQL and SPA” by dhilipsiva (June 4, 2021, 11:45 a.m. → June 4, 2021, 11:30 a.m.)
  • “Get interactive! Putting a shell (or a desktop) in your Django app” by Maari Tamm, Florian Haas (June 4, 2021, 11 a.m. → June 4, 2021, 10:45 a.m.)
  • “Speed up your tests with setUpTestData” by Adam Johnson (June 4, 2021, 9:30 a.m. → June 4, 2021, 9:15 a.m.)

entry.title: New DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule released (0.1)
entry.summary:
The first DjangoCon Europe 2021 schedule has been released!

This is where it all began.
